item.title: Engsci Year 2 Winter
item.description: Table of Contents TEP 327: Engineering and Law Resources ECE286: Probability and Statistics Lecture 1 ECE259: Electromagnetism BME205: Introduction to Biomedical Engineering Cells PHY294: Quantum and Thermal Physics ESC204: Praxis III TEP 327: Engineering and Law Why do engineers need to know about law? Engineering ends up stepping across a lot of jurisdictions, so we kinda need to know about it.

item.title: some poems
item.description: Table of Contents The Jackdaw Echolalia Making it a commitment for 2022 to read some poems. The Jackdaw William Cowper source There is a bird who, by his coat And by the hoarseness of his note, Might be supposed a crow; A great frequenter of the church, Where, bishop-like, he finds a perch, And dormitory too. Above the steeple shines a plate, That turns and turns, to indicate

item.title: Using NeoVim for ROS2 c++ development
item.description: Using clangd ROS2 puts its headers into a rather non-standard location, /opt/ros2/<ROS_DISTRO>/include. Obviously this doesn’t play well with standard clangd setups, and it would be too easy if it just worked out of the box with vim! Most editors like vscode or clion have their own way of handling scenarios like this, e.g. vscode using a c_cpp_properties.json file. For vscode setup, see this or this With vim this is as little uglier.

item.title: Engsci Y2S1 Exam Review
item.description: Exam ‘cheat sheets’ for EngSci 2nd year semester fall semester. These were made as part of my own studying for the exams. As 3/6 of my exams were cancelled due to the omicron covid variant, AER210, MAT292, and PHY293 are missing. I do not guarantee content correctness – but if you find a mistake, please let me know! Table of Contents CHE260 Variables Heat Transfer Mechanisms Steady Heat Transfer Transient Heat Transfer Forced Convection Heat Transfer Radiation Heat Transfer ECE253: Digital and Computer Systems Logic and Circuits Verilog ARM Assembly MAT292 AER210 PHY293 ESC203 CHE260 Note: the following only contains materials for the final exam, so it will only cover the heat-transfer portion of CHE260.

item.title: Advent of Code 2021
item.description: Table of Contents Day 6 Day 7 Day 8 Day 9 Day 10 Day 12 Day 13 Day 14 Day 15 Day 16 Day 17 Day 18 Day 19 Day 20 Day 21 Day 22 Day 23 Day 24 Day 25 This page will track some notes and TILs for AoC2021, which I will be completing in rust – a language I am still learning.

item.title: (g)o (w)eb (s)erver
item.description: Deploying your personal website onto github pages is so 2013. Why avoid the hassle of self-hosting with a static site generator and server? Why not just use something tried and tested by the community? It’s just not as fun … and I didn’t feel like studying for a final one afternoon. So here’s a simple 111-line golang webserver that you can use to deploy your personal website. There’s also some cute figlet art

item.title: About me
item.description: What am I up to right now? aUToronto Systems & Simulations team: Automated testing & evaluation of autonomous vehicles Research @ ISML: I work with accelerating machine learning tasks on memristor crossbars – first author paper pending submission Web dev & data collection for BC Parks Foundation: currently in public alpha Side Projects TA-ing programming Trying to make it through university! Connect with me: Check out my cooking instagram
